verses.verse: Remember <WH2142> now your Creator <WH1254> in the days <WH3117> of your youth, <WH979> while <WH5704> the evil <WH7451> days <WH3117> come <WH935> not, nor the years <WH8141> draw near, <WH5060> when <WH834> you shall say, <WH559> I have no <WH369> pleasure <WH2656> in them;
While <WH5704> the sun, <WH8121> or the light, <WH216> or the moon, <WH3394> or the stars, <WH3556> be not darkened, <WH2821> nor the clouds <WH5645> return <WH7725> after <WH310> the rain: <WH1653>

In the day <WH3117> when the keepers <WH8104> of the house <WH1004> shall tremble, <WH2111> and the strong <WH2428> men <WH582> shall bow <WH5791> themselves, and the grinders <WH2912> cease <WH988> because <WH3588> they are few, <WH4592> and those that look <WH7200> out of the windows <WH699> be darkened, <WH2821>

And the doors <WH1817> shall be shut <WH5462> in the streets, <WH7784> when the sound <WH6963> of the grinding <WH2913> is low, <WH8217> and he shall rise <WH6965> up at the voice <WH6963> of the bird, <WH6833> and all <WH3605> the daughters <WH1323> of music <WH7892> shall be brought <WH7817> low; <WH7817>

Also <WH1571> when they shall be afraid <WH3372> of that which is high, <WH1364> and fears <WH2849> shall be in the way, <WH1870> and the almond <WH8247> tree shall flourish, <WH5006> and the grasshopper <WH2284> shall be a burden, <WH5445> and desire <WH35> shall fail: <WH6565> because <WH3588> man <WH120> goes <WH1980> to his long <WH5769> home, <WH1004> and the mourners <WH5594> go <WH5437> about <WH5437> the streets: <WH7784>

Or <WH5704> ever the silver <WH3701> cord <WH2256> be loosed, <WH7368> or the golden <WH2091> bowl <WH1543> be broken, <WH7533> or the pitcher <WH3537> be broken <WH7665> at <WH5921> the fountain, <WH4002> or the wheel <WH1534> broken <WH7533> at <WH413> the cistern. <WH953>
Then shall the dust <WH6083> return <WH7725> to the earth <WH776> as it was: and the spirit <WH7307> shall return <WH7725> to God <WH430> who <WH834> gave <WH5414> it.
Vanity <WH1892> of vanities, <WH1892> said <WH559> the preacher; <WH6953> all <WH3605> is vanity. <WH1892>

And moreover, <WH3148> because the preacher <WH6953> was wise, <WH2450> he still <WH5750> taught <WH3925> the people <WH5971> knowledge; <WH1847> yes, he gave good heed, <WH238> and sought <WH2713> out, and set in order <WH8626> many <WH7235> proverbs. <WH4912>
The preacher <WH6953> sought <WH1245> to find <WH4672> out acceptable <WH2656> words: <WH1697> and that which was written <WH3789> was upright, <WH3476> even words <WH1697> of truth. <WH571>

The words <WH1697> of the wise <WH2450> are as goads, <WH1861> and as nails <WH4930> fastened <WH5193> by the masters <WH1167> of assemblies, <WH627> which are given <WH5414> from one <WH259> shepherd. <WH7462>

And further, <WH3148> by these, <WH1992> my son, <WH1121> be admonished: <WH2094> of making <WH6213> many <WH7235> books <WH5612> there is no <WH369> end; <WH7093> and much <WH7235> study <WH3854> is a weariness <WH3024> of the flesh. <WH1320>

Let us hear <WH8085> the conclusion <WH5490> of the whole <WH3605> matter: <WH1697> Fear <WH3372> God, <WH430> and keep <WH8104> his commandments: <WH4687> for this <WH2088> is the whole <WH3605> duty <WH1697> of man. <WH120>

For God <WH430> shall bring <WH935> every <WH3605> work <WH4639> into judgment, <WH4941> with every <WH3605> secret <WH5956> thing, whether <WH518> it be good, <WH2896> or whether <WH518> it be evil. <WH7451>
